label: 檜
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: Chamaecyparis obtusa. One of the most popular woods in Japan from ancient times to the present day. Hard and durable with an even grain, it is ideally suited to architecture, sculpture, and applied arts. In the Shōsō-in, hinoki is used for in offering tables, boxes, bentwood containers, and other objects. 　[正倉院]
